page.title: 19West Lavington Church.
page.content: We interviewed the Reverend Osborn.We asked him how old the church is.He said that it was about 700 years old.The busiest service is the Sunday morning service.Mr.Osborn also thinks the church is changing.He has been at the church for 5 and a half years ,and in the village for 28 years.The church holds 350-400 people.There is a Sunday school of 6 or 7 children run by Mrs.Newby, a choir, bellringers, and a Mothers Union.The normal congregation is about 50, but at Easter and Christmas it can be up to a 100.The Church Wardens are Mr. Walter Burt, who lives in Potterne and Mr.Hugh Davey, who lives in Lavington.The service that Mr.Osborn uses is{Rite B or{Series 2}.There are about 28 people on the P.C.C.
